q: Tax invoice is issued for supply of taxable goods or services.
Tax invoice is governed by section ______ of CGST Act.
Tax invoice must be issued before or at the time of removal of goods.
For services, invoice must be issued before or after provision of service.
Tax invoice must contain GSTIN of the supplier.
Tax invoice must have consecutive serial number.
Serial number can contain alphabets, numerals, and special characters.
Maximum characters in invoice serial number is ______.
Invoice must contain date of issue.
Match invoice mandatory fields:
Name and address of recipient is required on invoice.
GSTIN of recipient is required for B2B invoices.
For B2C invoices, recipient's GSTIN is not required.
Place of supply must be mentioned on invoice.
State code of place of supply is required for inter-state supply.
Rearrange invoice header details:
Description of goods or services must be mentioned on invoice.
HSN code for goods is mandatory based on turnover.
SAC code for services is mandatory based on turnover.
Quantity and unit of goods must be stated.
Total value of supply must be mentioned on invoice.
Match invoice item details:
Taxable value is value excluding GST.
Rate of tax must be mentioned on invoice.
Amount of tax charged must be shown separately.
For intra-state supply, ______ must be shown.
For inter-state supply, ______ must be shown.
Rearrange invoice tax details:
Signature or digital signature of supplier is required.
Electronic invoice does not require physical signature.
Invoice in triplicate is required for goods supply.
Original copy of invoice is for ______.
Duplicate copy of invoice is for ______.
Match invoice copies:
Bill of supply is issued for exempt supplies.
Bill of supply is issued by composition dealer.
Bill of supply does not contain tax amount.
Bill of supply must mention 'composition taxable person' for composition dealer.
Bill of supply is governed by section ______ of CGST Act.
Rearrange bill of supply contents:
Receipt voucher is issued when payment is received before supply.
Receipt voucher must be issued within ______ days of advance receipt.
answers: No specific timeline, at time of receipt

q: Receipt voucher must contain supplier GSTIN.
Receipt voucher must mention amount of advance.
Tax is payable on advance for services.
Match advance receipt documents:
right: At time of receipt for services

q: Payment voucher is issued when payment is made under RCM.
Payment voucher is self-generated by recipient.
Payment voucher must contain details of unregistered supplier.
Amount of payment must be mentioned on payment voucher.
Payment voucher serial number must be unique.
Rearrange RCM documentation:
Credit note is issued when invoice value is reduced.
Credit note is issued for return of goods by recipient.
Credit note reduces the tax liability of supplier.
Credit note must contain reference to original invoice.
Credit note is governed by section ______ of CGST Act.
Match credit note scenarios:
Debit note is issued when invoice value is increased.
Debit note increases the tax liability.
Debit note is issued for additional charges after invoice.
Debit note must reference original invoice.
Debit note is governed by section ______ of CGST Act.
Rearrange debit/credit note process:
Credit note must be declared in GSTR-1.
Debit note must be declared in GSTR-1.
Time limit for credit note is September following the year or annual return filing, whichever is ______.
Credit note issued after time limit has no effect on tax liability.
Recipient must reduce ITC on receipt of credit note.
Match note effects:
E-invoicing is electronic generation of invoice.
E-invoicing is mandatory for turnover exceeding Rs. ______ crore.
E-invoice is generated through ______ portal.
IRP stands for Invoice Registration Portal.
E-invoice contains IRN which is unique identification.
Rearrange e-invoice generation:
IRN is ______ character unique hash.
QR code on e-invoice is digitally signed.
QR code contains key invoice details.
E-invoice details are auto-populated in GSTR-1.
E-way bill can be generated from e-invoice portal.
Match e-invoice components:
E-invoice schema follows ______ format.
E-invoice has mandatory and optional fields in schema.
Supplier GSTIN is mandatory in e-invoice.
Document type like INV, CRN, DBN is mandatory.
E-invoice for export must have shipping bill details.
Rearrange e-invoice schema structure:
Cancelled e-invoice cannot be regenerated with same number.
E-invoice can be cancelled within ______ hours.
After 24 hours, e-invoice cancellation requires credit note.
Cancelled e-invoice status is updated on IRP.
E-invoice amendment is done through credit/debit notes.
Match e-invoice corrections:
Dynamic QR code is for B2C invoices.
Dynamic QR is mandatory for turnover exceeding Rs. ______ crore.
Dynamic QR allows payment through UPI apps.
Dynamic QR must contain payment details.
Penalty for non-compliance with QR code is Rs. ______ per invoice.
Rearrange B2C QR code requirements:
Revised invoice is issued for changes before first return filing.
Revised invoice is allowed for migrated taxpayers from pre-GST.
Revised invoice must reference original invoice.
Time limit for revised invoice was ______ month from registration.
Normal business does not use revised invoice, uses credit/debit notes.
Match invoice revision scenarios:
Delivery challan is used for movement without supply.
Delivery challan is used for job work.
Delivery challan is for goods sent on approval basis.
Delivery challan is for movement between own branches within state.
Delivery challan must have consecutive serial number.
Rearrange delivery challan uses:
Delivery challan is in triplicate for goods.
Challan must contain description and quantity of goods.
Challan must mention HSN code.
Value of goods is not mandatory on challan if not determinable.
Signature is required on delivery challan.
Match challan and invoice differences:
Consolidated invoice can be issued for multiple supplies in a day.
Consolidated invoice is allowed for B2C supplies.
Consolidated invoice value limit was Rs. ______ per day.
Consolidated invoice summarizes multiple transactions.
Individual invoices are not required if consolidated is issued for small value.
Rearrange consolidated invoice criteria:
Proforma invoice is not a tax invoice.
Proforma invoice is for quotation purposes.
Proforma invoice does not create tax liability.
Actual tax invoice replaces proforma on supply.
Proforma invoice is used for export quota purposes.

Self-invoice is issued for RCM purchases from unregistered.
Self-invoice must contain details of unregistered supplier.
Self-invoice serial must be separate from regular invoices.

SEZ supply invoice is similar to export invoice.

Invoice for continuous supply of goods follows special rules.
Continuous supply invoice is issued when successive statements are involved.
Electricity supply is example of continuous supply.

Invoice for continuous supply is issued before or at time of issue of statement.

Time of supply for goods is earlier of invoice date or payment date.
If invoice not issued within time, time of supply is date of removal.

Payment recorded in books triggers time of supply.
Payment credited to bank account triggers time of supply.

Invoice must be issued within ______ days for goods.

ISD invoice has different format from regular invoice.
ISD invoice must mention it is an ISD document.

Invoice-wise details are required in GSTR-1 for B2B.
B2C invoices above Rs. 2.5 lakh need invoice-wise reporting.
B2C small invoices are reported in consolidated manner.

Documents summary table lists issued, cancelled invoices.

Duplicate invoice is allowed only if original is lost.
Duplicate invoice must be marked as 'duplicate'.

Duplicate invoice does not create double tax liability.

Supplementary invoice must contain all mandatory fields.

Penalty for incorrect invoice is Rs. ______ or tax evaded.
Invoice without GSTIN is invalid for ITC.

Recipient cannot claim ITC on non-compliant invoice.

Multi-currency invoice must show INR equivalent.

Discount must be known at time of supply for deduction from value.

Invoice numbering must be continuous per financial year.
Multiple series of invoices are allowed.

Cancelled invoices must be reported in GSTR-1.

Invoice format is not prescribed, only contents are prescribed.
Invoice can be in any language with all prescribed details.

Airport/port invoice has special provisions.
SEZ invoice requires endorsement sometimes.
Exhibition invoice for display goods has special treatment.
Fairs and exhibitions may use consolidated invoicing.

Incorrect HSN on invoice leads to rejection of ITC.
